contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Yahweh's care for his people is compared to that of a father. Alternate translation: "Yahweh your God has taken care of you, like a father takes care of his son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh your God carried you, as a man carries his son

contextId.occurrenceNote: A "bee" is a small, flying insect that flies in large groups and stings people who threaten them. This means that so many Amorites attacked the Israelite soldiers that they had to leave the battle. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-unknown]])
Yahweh is powerful and able to destroy the armies of the other nations. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
This emphasizes the large number of Israelites that were with Moses. Alternate translation: "more than you can count" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: as many as the stars of the heavens

contextId.occurrenceNote: This compares how long the people could stay in the land to how long the sky will exist above the earth. This is a way of saying "forever." Alternate translation: "to give them as a possession forever" or "to allow them to live there forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: to give them for as long as the heavens are above the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: "You will be like blind people who grope in darkness even at noonday." The Israelites will have a difficult life even when everyone else is enjoying life. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: You will grope about at noonday like the blind grope in the darkness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means the enemy will come suddenly and the Israelites will not be able to stop them. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like an eagle flies to its victim

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that in the past there were many Israelites. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: you were like the stars of the heavens in number

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means Yahweh wants the people to eagerly accept his helpful teaching. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Let my teaching drop down like the rain ... and like the showers on the plants

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means Yahweh watched over and protected the Israelites while they were in the desert. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: As an eagle that guards her nest and flutters over her young, Yahweh spread out his wings and took them, and carried them on his pinions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means the people of Gad are strong and secure, and they will defeat their enemies in war. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: He will live there like a lioness, and he will tear off an arm or a head
